</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Make the person tell to the receiver the sentence. See [[Conversations]] for more details.

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> Two units cannot talk on the same channel at the same time, this can lead to weird effects for non-local listeners; make sure not to use the same channel at the same time in multiplayer. </value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> person [[kbTell]] [receiver, topicName, sentenceClass(, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, (…), forceRadio)]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> person: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [receiver, topicName, sentenceClass, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, (…), forceRadio]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> sentenceClass: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> argumentArray1toN (Optional): [[Array]] - [argumentName, argumentValue, argumentText, argumentSpeech]:
* argumentName: [[String]]
* argumentValue: [[Code]]
* argumentText: [[String]]
* argumentSpeech: [[Array]] of [[String|Strings]] - each string is an already defined word in config.

</value></part><part><name>p7</name>=<value> forceRadio (Optional): [[Boolean]], [[Number]] or [[String]] (''last value of the array'')
* [[Boolean]] true/false to force use of radio
* [[Number]] 1-10 to force use of custom radio channel
* [[String]] name of radio channel to use, from: 'GLOBAL', 'SIDE', 'GROUP', 'VEHICLE', 'DIRECT', 'COMMAND'

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[kbTell]] [BIS_HQ, "myTopic", "playerSentence1"];</code>
